fields.value: Update, A Global Measure of Judicial Independence, 1900-2015

dsDescriptionValue.value:
Update of Latent Judicial Independence scores described in Linzer and Staton (2015). Newer versions of Cingranelli-Richards (CIRI), Polity IVâ€™s executive constraints (XCONST), PRS Group, Feld-Voigt, and Global Competitiveness Report (GCR) are included. Two measures of de facto judicial independence were included from the Varieties of Democracy Project (V-Dem), high court independence (v2juhcind) and high court compliance (v2juhccomp).

Suggested citation. 

We suggest that you cite both the original paper describing the model as well as the dataset itself. See citation information.

publicationCitation.value:
Linzer, Drew A. and Jeffrey K. Staton. 2015. "A Global Measure of Judicial Independence, 1948-2012." 3(2): 223-256.

Linzer, Drew A., Jordan Holsinger, Christopher Reenock, and Jeffrey K. Staton. 2019. Latent Judicial Independence Scores. Emory University.

files.description: Contains the manifest indicators of judicial independence.
files.label: jimeasures_1210.tab

dataFile.description: Contains the manifest indicators of judicial independence.

files.description: This file contains the estimates of latent judicial independence from 1948 to 2015. The model was fit to the original indicators used in Linzer and Staton (2015), using new values of those scores updated through 2015.
files.label: LJI-estimates-20170321.tab

dataFile.description: This file contains the estimates of latent judicial independence from 1948 to 2015. The model was fit to the original indicators used in Linzer and Staton (2015), using new values of those scores updated through 2015.

files.description: This file contains the estimates of latent judicial independence from 1900 to 2015. The model was fit to the original indicators used in Linzer and Staton (2015), plus values of XCONST dated back to 1900 and two measures from the Varieties of Democracy Project.
files.label: LJI-estimates-20181210.tab

dataFile.description: This file contains the estimates of latent judicial independence from 1900 to 2015. The model was fit to the original indicators used in Linzer and Staton (2015), plus values of XCONST dated back to 1900 and two measures from the Varieties of Democracy Project.

files.description: Describes data used to produce the updated estimates of latent judicial independence.
